quest.name: Volunteer Dragonslayers
journal: Minfilia would have you assist with the preparations being made for the defense of Ishgard.

Hoping to rally support for Ishgard, Minfilia has once more dispatched your comrades to every corner of the realm. The tasks she has in mind for you, however, will keep you close to Revenant's Toll. In addition to recruiting volunteers from among the adventuring population, the Antecedent wishes you to consult with Slafborn regarding the town's state of readiness. Speak first with Tataru, and invite the receptionist to join you and the Adventurers' Guild representative in discussing the troubles that might spill over the border from the conflict in Coerthas.

You explain Minfilia's request to Tataru, who immediately begins to plan for every possible eventuality. Follow in the enterprising young receptionist's wake, and join her in consulting with Slafborn.

Though Slafborn readily acknowledges the importance of elevating the Toll's state of readiness, he is unwilling to make any formal commitment to assist in the coming conflict. Consult with Tataru regarding the possibility of approaching adventurers directly.
Tataru seems more than happy to recruit volunteers face-to-face. Speak with the adventurers in Revenant's Toll and attempt to rally them to Ishgard's cause.

You have approached a number of adventurers, and been greeted with responses ranging from cautious interest to barely concealed hostility. After being rebuffed by a particularly reluctant Roegadyn, you are suddenly pulled aside by Riol, who proceeds to explain the suspicious circumstances surrounding the disappearance of Wilred, the youth from Little Ala Mhigo. With battle looming on the horizon, however, there is little time for you to delve into this latest mystery. Return to Tataru and inform her of the results of your recruiting efforts.

You compare notes with Tataru, and are pleased to find that her recruitment efforts have met with similar results. Should those who expressed an interest be true to their word, the forces of Ishgard will soon be bolstered by a small-but-experienced contingent of adventurers...
objectives: Speak with Slafborn in Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I have bid the Archons travel to their assigned nations.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Should the members of the Alliance agree to pledge Grand Company soldiers to Ishgard's cause, our comrades will be on hand to act as intermediaries for the duration of the conflict.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...The small matter of persuading the Alliance leaders to grant such support I leave to Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: For you, my friend, a different task awaits: I would have you reach out to your fellow adventurers, and gather what allies you may for the coming siege.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I would also have you consider the matter of our own security. Revenant's Toll is but a short flight from the snowfields of Coerthas─it is not unimaginable that the fighting may spill across the border.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Pray brief Slafborn on the brewing conflict, and discuss potential contingencies. The frontier settlers must be prepared for aught that might wing its way over our walls.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text:
I only hope that such precautions prove unnecessary...
Ah, before you leave─might I suggest that you have Tataru accompany you? She has a talent for administration, and a firm grasp of the practical challenges we may encounter.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Hmm... We are rather close to Coerthas, aren't we? We'd best see to our own defenses and take stock of our supplies.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Oh, and we'll also need to have beds and bandages laid out just in case.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: A good receptionist is ready for any eventuality! Let's go, Forename─I've a hundred and one things to discuss with Slafborn!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: ...And so I'd like you to spread the word to the settlers and adventurers in town.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: I appreciate the warning. If war is coming to Coerthas, then the Toll must be made ready.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: I'll increase the number of patrols and lookouts immediately. I'll also see about finding room for an infirmary, as well as temporary housing for victims of the conflict. Ishgard has done well by us in the past and I would return the favor.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: But as for rounding up volunteers for the fighting itself, I'm afraid I must disappoint you. I will not send my fellow guild members to die on Ishgardian soil, and I am certain headquarters will say the same.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: There will be no official Adventurers' Guild presence at this siege. That said...each adventurer is of course free to do as he or she will.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: ...I shall have a word with some of my more capable colleagues on your behalf, and you might try your luck here in Revenant's Toll. I daresay there are a few stout souls about town who will answer your call to arms.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: I'll see if I can't persuade a few friends to join the cause. While I do that, why not try asking around for volunteers here in the Toll? I daresay you'll find a few who are willing to help. But do make sure they're up to the task, will you? You want to fight the dragons, not feed them.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Let's get started, shall we? We have a town to rouse!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Attention, adventurers! Ishgard is in peril and has need of heroes! If you've ever dreamed of battling a Dravanian, then now is your chance!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERA00391
dialogue.text: If ye know of any payin' work, lasslad, I'm all ears. Us adventurers should look out for each other, eh?

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERB00391
dialogue.text: Ah, the freedom to roam where I will... Would that I had quit the stifling confines of my homeland sooner...

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERC00391
dialogue.text: Revenant's Toll continues to grow, as does the number of travelers who pass through its gates. Between you and me, I'm having a hard time keeping an eye on them all.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERD00391
dialogue.text: Adventuring is, by its nature, an unpredictable business. With planning and preparation, you can mitigate some of the risks...but if you don't trust your instincts, you won't last long.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERA00391
dialogue.text: Sell me blade to the Ishgardians? Well...them dragons are a fearsome lot, but I'd slay me fair share if the coin was good.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERA00391
dialogue.text: I've worked for one o' them knights before, ye know. Watched me like a bloody hawk, he did. Still, I'd put up with worse than that for a heavy purse.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERB00391
dialogue.text: Volunteer my services in the defense of Ishgard? I think not.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERB00391
dialogue.text: Dragons claimed the lives of every one of my brothers─I do not mean to offer them mine. 'Twas to escape such a fate that I took up the mantle of adventurer in the first place. I would sooner die in the pursuit of fortune than huddled behind an icy wall.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERC00391
dialogue.text: So Ishgard seeks sellswords to bolster its ranks, eh? Though I'm not sure I like the sound of this siege, those nobles will surely be generous with their rewards...

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERC00391
dialogue.text: Ah, but I have pledged myself to guard Revenant's Toll. Modest work though it is, I am loath to break the terms of my contract. What to do, what to do...

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERD00391
dialogue.text: Spare me your talk of glory and fame─I'm not in the habit of volunteering for lost causes.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURERD00391
dialogue.text: I've survived this long by trusting my instincts, and my instincts tell me to stay well away from Ishgard.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Ishgard sounds like she's in a right mess...but that ain't what I wanted to talk to ye about.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: I need ye to cast yer mind back to that scuffle with the Empire out by the processin' plant. A lad from Little Ala Mhigo by the name o' Wilred was there with the 4th that day, an' I want to know if ye've seen him since. Have ye?

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, I feared as much... No one's bloody seen him. It's like the ground opened up an' swallowed him whole.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: But that ain't all. Around the time Wilred stopped turnin' up for duty, them black market weapons went missin' from our vault in Ul'dah...

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: So now, o' course, half the Braves suspect the lad o' makin' off with the goods.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Folk like to believe our company's a disciplined fightin' force, but as you an' me both know, it's no more'n a motley collection o' mercenaries, adventurers, an' Grand Company veterans.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: The only thing as binds us together is some vague oath about fightin' for the freedom of all. That an' the steady pay.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Now, compared to most others in this crew, Wilred's a fresh-faced novice─a bleedin' whelp amongst wolves.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: But the boy's got passion. When he talked about bein' a guardian of Eorzea, he bloody well meant it. A lad like him wouldn't rob us blind an' bugger off like that. He ain't the type.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: An' then─an' this is just between you an' me, mind─there's the fact that the lad wanted to tell me about somethin' queer he'd noticed in the ledgers. Somethin' about the Braves' numbers not addin' up...

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Aye, there's a villain at the end o' this trail I've stumbled on, an' I'll bet me good eye it ain't young Wilred.

dialogue.name: RIOL
dialogue.text: Anyroad, ye've got a war to wage, so I'll let ye get on. I just thought someone should know... I'll be seein' ye, Forename.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename! So? Did you sway any hearts?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: One or two, eh? Well, added to mine, that makes three or four, not including Slafborn's friends! We won't have the largest company in the army, but I'd say one Revenant's Toll veteran is worth a dozen clanking knights at least!
